public boolean addThread(int priority,
                         int PC)
Adds a thread, if there's enough space.

Parameters:
priority -

Returns:
true if new thread creation was successfull, false elsewhere

setCurProc

public void setCurProc(int pid)
Sets current process. (this method is only used for bootstrapping purposes)

Parameters:
pid - the new current process

testProcessState

public int testProcessState(int proc)
Tests if a process is wether dead or not runnable.

Parameters:
proc - the ID of the process
Returns:
0 if the process is dead, 1 if it's not runnable, 2 elsewhere

testPriority

public boolean testPriority(int priority)
Tests if the current thread's priority is lesser than the value specified

Parameters:
priority -
Returns:
true if the given priority is higher (lesser) than the current thread's one, false elsewhere

public int getPID()
Returns the current processID.

Returns:

getTID

public int getTID()
Returns the current threadID.

Returns:
a unique TID

swapOutCurrentThread

public void swapOutCurrentThread()
Saves current thread status.

runNextThread

public boolean runNextThread()
Runs the next runnable thread with the highest priority. Schedule within threads with the same priority is executed with a FIFO algorithm. Please make attention that this method doesn't do any check with the current thread... it's a programmer job to swap out this one, before calling this method.

Returns:
false if there aren't runnable threads in the process, true elsewhere

holdCurrentThread

public void holdCurrentThread()
Holds current thread.

restartThread

public int restartThread(int pid,
                         int tid)
Restarts current thread.

Parameters:
pid - the owner process' ID
tid - the id of the thread to restart
Returns:
thread's priority if thread has been restarted, -1 elsewhere

killCurrentThread

public void killCurrentThread()
Kills current thread. This istruction is used when thread calls wrong opcodes, or protection faultes.

ageCurrentThread

public int ageCurrentThread()
Ages current thread decreasing by one its priority.

Returns:
the new priority of the thread

contextSwitch

public boolean contextSwitch()
Context switch: test if there's a winner process, then tests the other processes to see wether they are in a running state; schedules the first running process.

Returns:
true if there's a winner, false if the battle continues
